messages.subject: Re: Help with mei and date on katana
messages.msgSnippet: ... As was replied by another, the painted characters are numbers, likely assembly numbers to match the sword to its fittings, which should be marked or
messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Verne Turpin <ren47@...> wrote:
> ... what do the red painted characters on the other side mean?

As was replied by another, the painted characters are numbers, likely
assembly numbers to match the sword to its fittings, which should be
marked or stamped with the equivalent number set.

NC

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Help with mei and date on katana
messages.msgSnippet: Hi John, Thanks so much for the info, what do the red painted characters on the other side mean? Not as old as I thought but thats why I m no expert and the
messages.messageBody:
Hi John,

Thanks so much for the info, what do the red painted characters on the other side mean?
Not as old as I thought but thats why I'm no expert and the clubs are such a great resource.
I have another sword that I know is old, I've been told Koto and its a cut down to wakasashi
size but I'll include photos this week.
I paid 300 for the pictured sword....too much or reasonable?

Pura Vida
Verne Turpin



________________________________
From: excelsiorilluminati <excelsiorilluminati@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, February 14, 2009 8:55:33 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Help with mei and date on katana


This is a showato signed "Noshu Ju Kunihiro". This is a mass produced
blade with a nakarishimei. A good example of a wartime factory produced
sword. John

--- In nihontostudy@ yahoogroups. com, "Verne" <ren47@...> wrote:
>
> I just purchased a WW11 mounted katana from a WW11 bring back from a
> local inheriter of sword. I have included photos listed under the
name
> ticoman. Has stamped signature on one side and japanese characters on
> opposite side of tang. Sword is an earlier hand forge blade in old
> polish, short katana size. Blade has beautiful solid hamon and full
> boshi, couple of battle nicks in blade.
> Any help would be greatly appreciated.
>
> Pura Vida
> Verne Turpin

messages.subject: Help with mei and date on katana
messages.msgSnippet: I just purchased a WW11 mounted katana from a WW11 bring back from a local inheriter of sword. I have included photos listed under the name ticoman. Has
messages.messageBody:
I just purchased a WW11 mounted katana from a WW11 bring back from a
local inheriter of sword. I have included photos listed under the name
ticoman. Has stamped signature on one side and japanese characters on
opposite side of tang. Sword is an earlier hand forge blade in old
polish, short katana size. Blade has beautiful solid hamon and full
boshi, couple of battle nicks in blade.
Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Pura Vida
Verne Turpin
